dmca.title: [ABUSE] Abuse 2144 - Offering Card Sharing Solutions
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf Of
Policy Enforcement
Sent: Monday, April 10, 2006 7:05 AM
To: DMCA
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Abuse 2144 - Offering Card Sharing Solutions]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

For your review.
- --
Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/

- -------- Original Message --------
From:         - Mon Apr 10 06:41:59 2006

1FSr1q-0005qP-QJ for abuse@theplanet.com; Mon, 10 Apr 2006 02:41:42 -0500

(Exim) id 1FSr1o-000IB8-PU for abuse@theplanet.com; Mon, 10 Apr 2006
02:41:42 -0500

mx2.irdetoaccess.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(5.0.2195.6713); Mon, 10 Apr
2006 09:41:39 +0200

content-class:         urn:content-classes:message

boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C65C72.345B6DC1"

<4012239A2EA9E242BC2985893E76675E02D5E527@NLHFD-XCH063.domain1.intra>

permitted nor denied by domain of irdeto.com) client-ip=193.173.45.2;
envelope-from=EBooth@irdeto.com; helo=mx2.irdetoaccess.com;

X-Spam-Score:         -100.2
Subject:         [ABUSE] Abuse 2144 - Offering Card Sharing Solutions

X-Mailman-Version:         2.1.7
Precedence:         list
List-Id:         <abuse.lists.theplanet.com>
List-Unsubscribe:         <http://lists.theplanet.com/mailman/listinfo/abuse>,
<mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=unsubscribe>
List-Post:         <mailto:abuse@lists.theplanet.com>
List-Help:         <mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=help>
List-Subscribe:         <http://lists.theplanet.com/mailman/listinfo/abuse>,
<mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=subscribe>
Sender:         abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com
Errors-To:         abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com



Dear Sir/Madam,

Please note that I am writing this notice on behalf of Irdeto Eindhoven
B.V., the Netherlands, in regard to the abovementioned matter. Please note
that the Philips Business Unit CryptoTec (the Philips CryptoWorks
Conditional Access activities) has now been incorporated in the Irdeto
Eindhoven B.V. entity.

In searching the Internet, Irdeto Eindhoven B.V. has established that the
website <http://www/>http://www
<http://www.boxcracker.org/portal/forum/index.php?topic=3455>_.boxcracker.or
g/portal/forum/index.php?topic=3455_
<http://www.boxcracker.org/portal/forum/index.php?topic=3455>
__ (?the Website?) infringes its intellectual property rights.
Furthermore, the content of the Website is unlawful, based on Clause 4 of
the Conditional Access Directive (98/84/EC).

Please provide me with the name and contact details of the owner of the
Website. Reference is made to the ruling of the Dutch Supreme Court of
25 November 2005 (Lycos/Pessers), in which the Supreme Court ruled that an
ISP should co-operate with third parties in retrieving the identity of the
operator of a website if the content of such website could be unlawful
towards those third parties.* *

**I hereby request to take sufficient action in order to remove the Website
from the Internet. I emphasize that an ISP can be held liable for infringing
information on websites for which it is responsible.
Furthermore, based on article 14 of the European Directive on Electronic
Commerce (2000/31/EC) (implemented in the Netherlands in article 6:196C of
the Dutch Civil Code) and based on the Digital Millennium Copyright Act
(article 512 US Copyright Act), an ISP is obliged to as soon as the ISP
obtains actual knowledge of illegal activity or information and is aware of
facts or circumstances from which the illegal activity or information is
apparent, to act expeditiously to remove or to disable access to the
information. Reference is made to the decision of the Court of Appeal of
Amsterdam, the Netherlands, dated 7 November 2002 (XS4ALL/Deutsche Bahn).

I hereby kindly request you to inform me within 3 days after the receipt of
this notice, whether or not you will act expeditiously to remove or to
disable access to the information and whether or not you will assist Irdeto
Eindhoven B.V. in retrieving the identity of the operator of the Website.

Yours sincerely,



*Irdeto*

Esmeralda Booth
